section.title: Install and configure controller node
section.para: This section describes how to install and configure the Compute service, code-named nova, on the controller node.

procedure.title: To configure prerequisites
procedure.para: Before you install and configure the Compute service, you must create a database, service credentials, and API endpoint.

step.para: To create the database, complete these steps:
Use the database access client to connect to the database server as the root user:
Create the nova database:
Grant proper access to the nova database:

screen.userinput: GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON nova.* TO 'nova'@'localhost' \ IDENTIFIED BY 'NOVA_DBPASS';
GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON nova.* TO 'nova'@'%' \ IDENTIFIED BY 'NOVA_DBPASS';

step.para: Replace NOVA_DBPASS with a suitable password.
Exit the database access client.
Source the admin credentials to gain access to admin-only CLI commands:
To create the service credentials, complete these steps:
Create the nova user:
Add the admin role to the nova user:

screen.userinput: openstack role add --project service --user nova admin

step.para: Create the nova service entity:

screen.userinput: openstack service create --type compute \ --description "OpenStack Compute" nova

step.para: Create the Compute service API endpoint:

screen.userinput: openstack endpoint create \ --publicurl http://controller:8774/v2/%\(tenant_id\)s \ --internalurl http://controller:8774/v2/%\(tenant_id\)s \ --adminurl http://controller:8774/v2/%\(tenant_id\)s \ --region regionOne \ compute

procedure.title: To install and configure Compute controller components

note.para: Default configuration files vary by distribution. You might need to add these sections and options rather than modifying existing sections and options. Also, an ellipsis (...) in the configuration snippets indicates potential default configuration options that you should retain.

step.para: Install the packages:

screen.userinput: apt-get install nova-api nova-cert nova-conductor nova-consoleauth \ nova-novncproxy nova-scheduler python-novaclient
yum install openstack-nova-api openstack-nova-cert openstack-nova-conductor \ openstack-nova-console openstack-nova-novncproxy openstack-nova-scheduler \ python-novaclient
zypper install openstack-nova-api openstack-nova-scheduler openstack-nova-cert \ openstack-nova-conductor openstack-nova-consoleauth openstack-nova-novncproxy \ python-novaclient iptables

step.para: Edit the /etc/nova/nova.conf file and complete the following actions:
Add a [database] section, and configure database access:
Replace NOVA_DBPASS with the password you chose for the Compute database.
In the [DEFAULT] and [oslo_messaging_rabbit] sections, configure RabbitMQ message queue access:
step.programlisting:
[DEFAULT] ... rpc_backend = rabbit
[oslo_messaging_rabbit] ... rabbit_host = controller rabbit_userid = openstack rabbit_password = RABBIT_PASS
step.para: Replace RABBIT_PASS with the password you chose for the openstack account in RabbitMQ.
In the [DEFAULT] and [keystone_authtoken] sections, configure Identity service access:
step.programlisting:
[DEFAULT] ... auth_strategy = keystone
[keystone_authtoken] ... auth_uri = http://controller:5000 auth_url = http://controller:35357 auth_plugin = password project_domain_id = default user_domain_id = default project_name = service username = nova password = NOVA_PASS
step.para: Replace NOVA_PASS with the password you chose for the nova user in the Identity service.

note.para: Comment out or remove any other options in the [keystone_authtoken] section.

procedure.title: To install and configure the Compute controller components

step.para: Install the packages:

screen.userinput: apt-get install nova-api nova-cert nova-conductor nova-consoleauth \ nova-novncproxy nova-scheduler python-novaclient

step.para: Respond to prompts for database management, Identity service credentials, service endpoint registration, and message queue credentials.
Edit the /etc/nova/nova.conf file and complete the following actions:
In the [DEFAULT] section, configure the VNC proxy to use the management interface IP address of the controller node:
Restart the Compute services:
Start the Compute services and configure them to start when the system boots:

screen.userinput: systemctl enable openstack-nova-api.service openstack-nova-cert.service \ openstack-nova-consoleauth.service openstack-nova-scheduler.service \ openstack-nova-conductor.service openstack-nova-novncproxy.service

systemctl start openstack-nova-api.service openstack-nova-cert.service \ openstack-nova-consoleauth.service openstack-nova-scheduler.service \ openstack-nova-conductor.service openstack-nova-novncproxy.service
